attributes.comment:
My husband and I would like to voice our concerns and objections to the proposed
fee increases in the document titled "Adjustment of the Immigration and
Naturalization Benefit Application and Petition Fee Schedule", docket # USCIS-
2006-0044. If the proposed rule is adopted, filing fees would increase by an
average of 66% over current fees. This proposed raising of fees will cause an
approximately $500 increase PER FAMILY working towards adopting an orphan
born internationally.

There are millions of orphans worldwide and thousands of American families who
are ready and willing to give these children a loving home. All too often, it is
financial barriers that keep these ophaned children from finding a loving family in
the United States. My husband and I recently adopted a beautiful 9 month old
Vietnamese girl with special needs. We chose to work through a highly
respected and ethical adoption agency and our adoption fees totalled over
$20,000. The proposed fee increase will only make this financial obstacle to
adoption even larger, potentially keeping more orphans from finding loving families.

Please DO NOT accept these proposed fee increases!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Stacy
